column4: try looking here or at realtek's website  http://www.opendrivers.com/driver/211089/realtek-alc650-alc655-ac97-audio-driver-a2.3-for-linux-free-download.html
I downloaded realtek-linux-audiopack-5.01.tar.bz2, extracted it, and ran sudo ./install - it went on for a while, and then came up with an error "Make[2]: *** [ja.gmo] Error 1"
try alsa,org and see what it says for your soundchip. i don't have realtek here,but most are supported bt default kernel,just need to know module  to load
